optitrack_conventional_marker_set.overview: The Conventional marker set is a full-body marker configuration used to capture human motion. It uses 39 reflective markers placed on specific anatomical landmarks to model the head, torso, waist, upper extremities, hands, lower extremities, and feet. The markers can be used with OptiTrack's motion capture system to reconstruct skeletal motion and joint centers.

segment.name: head

marker.location: Posterior head (approx. 2 cm behind left ear)
Posterior head (approx. 2 cm behind right ear)

segment.placement: Anterior markers (LAH/RAH): left and right sides of the forehead. Posterior markers (LPH/RPH): left and right sides of the head, roughly 2 cm behind the ear.

segment.name: torso
segment.placement: SJN: topmost section of the sternum, center of clavicle bones. SXS: about 1-2 cm above where the rib cages meet. CV7: prominent C7 vertebra at the base of the neck. TV2: second thoracic vertebra, ~3 spine levels below C7, at shoulder height. TV7: near the centre of the thoracic spinal column.

segment.name: waist
segment.placement: LIAS/RIAS: protruding bones at the front of the pelvis (ASIS). LIPS/RIPS: two dimples near the spine above the hips (PSIS). Key for modeling the pelvis, which governs other segments.

segment.name: upper_extremity
segment.placement: LCAJ/RCAJ: T-pose; palpate protruding bone at end of clavicle. LHLE/RHLE: lateral elbow; flex/extend arm to find axis. LUA/RUA: groove between triceps on mid-humerus (minimal skin motion).

segment.name: hand
segment.placement: LHM2/RHM2: slightly below the index-finger knuckle. LUSP/RUSP: lateral side of the wrist axis (ulna styloid). LRSP/RRSP: medial side of the wrist axis (radius styloid). Arrange three markers per hand asymmetrically; offset LHM2/RHM2 positions to distinguish L/R.

segment.name: lower_extremity
segment.placement: LFLE/RFLE: lateral prominence of knee joint axis (femur epicondyle); flex/extend knee. LTH/RTH: front centre of each thigh; offset L/R heights. LSK/RSK: shin bone near midline; offset heights. LTTC/RTTC: tibial tubercle, ~2-3 cm below kneecap, most anterior point of tibia.
segment.joint_modeling: Knee and ankle joint centres: midpoints between lateral and medial markers (FLE/FME for knee; FAL/TAM for ankle). Virtual hip joint: aligned with acetabulum centre, modeled using IAS/IPS markers.

segment.name: foot
segment.placement: LFAL/RFAL: lateral ankle axis, lateral malleolus prominence. LFM2/RFM2: dorsal 2nd metatarsal. (Optional.) LFCC/RFCC: heel centre, Achilles-calcaneus attachment.

custom_medial_markers.description: User-added medial markers supplementing the standard 39-marker set. Placed at medial counterparts of existing lateral markers. Used to define joint axes and calculate joint centres. Correspond to red-labelled markers in the reference skeleton.
custom_medial_markers.note: Custom names differ from OptiTrack standard naming.

naming_map.description: OptiTrack standard ID -> user custom name

references.ref: Leardini et al. (2011). Multi-segment trunk kinematics during locomotion. Clinical Biomechanics, 26, 562-571.
Leardini et al. (2007). Anatomically based protocol for gait analysis in children. Gait & Posture, 26, 560-571.
